Starting out as graphic designer, my commissions included illustrations, print and web design, matte paintings, light projections, and much more.

linguist.0:
Sadly, we teach languages the same way we teach History or Maths.  
New language students are quickly discouraged because it feels like **too much** commitment in **time and effort**. In addition, the course is not revolving around their interests and needs. There has to be a breaking change in _how_ we teach languages.
linguist.1:
I have dedicated a lot of my work life on UI/UX (user interface and user experience) and marketing, while spending my pastime on languages. I learned most of German, English, and French at home and in school, but learned Indonesian, Spanish, a bit of Italian and Haitian Creole (and just started Russian and Swedish) using my own system.  
  
A lot of shortcomings of **language learning apps** can be counteracted with a lot of what I have learned in computer science, design, and marketing.  
  
<u>As such I have made it my mission to make learning of languages effective and fun!</u>
linguist.2: Using my coding skills I started to create small games for rapid language learning that I share here: [https://medium.com/polygoat](https://medium.com/polygoat)
linguist.headline: the Linguist
linguist.subheadline: Learning languages has to be fun.

animator.0: I have earned a BFA in Visual Effects from the [Academy of Art University in SF](https://www.academyart.edu/), majoring in animation. Compositing and Matte Painting have always been a passion of mine, and so I was able to put my knowledge to use working as compositor for VFX studios Dropout and [Studio 400A](https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/2599944/).
animator.1: Eversince, I have shifted my focus to animation in the web – read more [here](/hats/mathHat).

copywriter.headline: the Copywriter
copywriter.body: Every now and then, I had the opportunity to write copy for advertising. Be it the hard drive advertisement in a revolving door saying **"How many revolutions per minute do you manage?"**, or concepts for **city-wide campaigns**: I am often considered a ~~grammar-Nazi~~ creative writer amongst co-workers and peers. And if there's nothing to write I can always just offer **€50** to the first person to beat my speed of 90 words per minute.

mathHat.0: I am currently working on an [animation engine for vector graphics](https://github.com/danborufka/danimator) with an according UI to animate paths on a segment point level.
mathHat.1: When I wasn't freelancing as web designer and developer, I had the opportunity to familiarise with the inner workings of agencies ranging from small [one-man](http://www.i-kiu.at/) [shops](http://www.bindertrittenwein.com/) to [multinational](http://www.dentsuaegisnetwork.com/) [networks](http://www.isobar.com), and joining [a startup](https://angel.co/sirenio) as UI/UX lead.
mathHat.2: I ended up hiring developers for the teams I lead, consulting other businesses with their coding workflow, and teaching a semester of programming at the [SAE institute](http://www.sae.edu/aut/).
mathHat.3: While at <abbr title='Academy of Art University in San Francisco'>AAU</abbr>, I earned money on the side writing and selling small plugins for Illustrator, After Effects, and Nuke (using JavaScript and Python mostly).
mathHat.4: I originally started out as Flash programmer, doing small agency work and entering the realm of web design. I got my first job because the boss stumbled upon my first interactive animation: a dinosaur that would pee himself after having pushed his bladder often enough.
mathHat.headline: the Programmer
mathHat.subheadline: The world would be a better place if everyone would speak JavaScript.
